abstract: Wal-Mart Stores agreed to pay $33.5 million in back wages plus interest to settle a federal overtime lawsuit.
snippet: Wal-Mart Stores agreed to pay $33.5 million in back wages plus interest to settle a federal overtime lawsuit.
lead_paragraph: The United States Labor Department announced yesterday that Wal-Mart Stores had agreed to pay $33.5 million in back wages plus interest to settle a federal lawsuit that accused the company of violating overtime laws involving 86,680 workers.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Settles U.S. Suit About Overtime
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Settles U.S. Suit About Overtime
